title: Wellness takes off at WTM
text:
Wellness takes off at WTM 18 August 2015 Save 
The inaugural WTM Wellness Lounge at World Travel Market London 2015 has already sold out of allotted space more than three months before the show. 
A total of 25 exhibitors, including 20 businesses making their debut appearance at the show, have booked space for the lounge which will be open from November 4 – 5. 
Those taking part will be given a private pod within the lounge, a networking breakfast with wellness buyers, priority access to WTM Speed Networking sessions and online networking tool. 
They will also get an invite to the Wellness Travel Awards Reception, exposure to the WTM Buyer database and access to 250 wellness buyers via the show’s visitor database. 
Exhibitors include Iceland’s Blue Lagoon, India’s Somatheeram Ayurveda Group and Visit Bath. 
New exhibitors include Anand Collection, which represents upmarket properties and resorts; the Hotels Plaza Andorra chain and Healing Hotels of the World. 
World Travel Market London senior director Simon Press said: “The success of our new Wellness Lounge reflects the rapid growth of the wellness industry generally. 
“The global wellness market is now valued at $3.4 trillion and is growing fast, as more people want to improve their physical and mental wellbeing during their leisure time. 
“Seeing our Wellness Lounge sell out so quickly demonstrates how the wellness industry is eager to have a high-profile platform provided by WTM London to negotiate and conclude deals.”
